Class CashRegister

java.lang.Object
CashRegister
public class CashRegister extends Object
This class is in charge of payment processes in the vending machine.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CashRegister()
    This constructor sets total sales, summary sales and denominations to their default values respectively.

  • Constructor Details

    • CashRegister

      public CashRegister()
      This constructor sets total sales, summary sales and denominations to their default values respectively.

  • Method Details

    • receivePaymentModel

      public boolean receivePaymentModel(float amountToPay, ArrayList<Float> tempPay)
      This method receives the payment and amount to be paid by the user and check if its right. It also checks if there's enough change, if necessary.
      Parameters:
      amountToPay - the total amount to be paid by the user
      tempPay - the payment of the user
      Returns:
      true if the payment is correct and there's enough change if needed. Otherwise returns false

    • giveMoneyModel

      public float giveMoneyModel(float amt)
      This method returns the money to the user
      Parameters:
      amt - is the amoumt to be returned to the user
      Returns:
      the money or change of the user

    • getDisplayText

      public ArrayList<String> getDisplayText()
      This method returns the denominationList
      Returns:
      Arraylist where the denomination texts are stored

    • setDenominationList

      public void setDenominationList()
      This method clears the content of denomination list

    • isEnoughChange

      public boolean isEnoughChange(float change, int[] count)
      This method checks if there's enough change for the transaction to proceed.
      Parameters:
      change - change of the customer.
      count - array which contains the count per denomination
      Returns:
      true if there's enough change. Otherwise, false.

    • setChange

      public void setChange()
      This method clears the arraylist of all denomination and sets it to zero

    • replenishChange

      public void replenishChange(int denomination, int amt)
      Replenishes the count of a specific denomination of change in the vending machine. This method increases the count of a specific denomination of change in the vending machine by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      denomination - the denomination of the change (e.g., 1, 5, 10, etc.)
      amt - the amount to replenish for the specified denomination

    • decreaseChange

      public void decreaseChange(int denomination, int amt)
      Decreases the count of a specific denomination of change in the vending machine. This method decreases the count of a specific denomination of change in the vending machine by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      denomination - the denomination of the change (e.g., 1, 5, 10, etc.)
      amt - the amount to replenish for the specified denomination
